member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ErrorCode.CapacityManagementError
member.summary:
The order failed capacity management checks or updates to the capacity totals failed.
CapacityExceededException on final submission of the order to the site and when site does not have capacity to process the order. The user will be given the option of accepting the next avaialable time at the site and continuing. The order needs to remain in the validated state when the submit fails so that when the user submits the order with the updated promise time, the order is in the validated state and capable of being submitted.

member.summary: HasUpdatedZeroCaloriesToNull
member.remarks: This marks whether we need to update all caloric values that are 0 to null. This is from the 18.5 release where we allow 0 for caloric value. Because all caloric value was stored as 0 in XML, but null in the db, we need to set all caloric value of 0 to null for only the first publish after 18.5.

member.name: M:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ImportXml.QuickComboLayoutXml.QuickComboMenuItemXml.Filter(System.Boolean,System.Func{System.Int64,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Modify QC by removing invisible entities(if not requested to include invisible) and where any referenced sales item IDs match. Used when sales item is exluded for site, or made invisible in Menu Configurator. If component is left with no groups, Quick Combo should not be ordered.
member.returns: True if QC has valid components.

member.name: M:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ImportXml.QuickComboLayoutXml.QuickComboMenuItemXml.UpdateQuickCombos(System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.List{Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ImportXml.QuickComboLayoutXml.QuickComboMenuItemXml},System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.Int64})
member.summary:
Modifies and return modified QuickCombos by removing Groups from Components, where any sales item ids match exludedSalesItemIds. QuickCombo is skipped if it has no Group left in any Component or if it is Invisible in case includeInvisible is false.
NOTE: objects in are modified. Need adjusting if you need to preserve original .
member.returns: Revised list of quick combos, along with Ids of removed quick combos and valid sales item ids.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ImportXml.DaypartSubMenuRestriction.RememberedStartTimeSerializationWrapper
member.summary: Just a wrapper for RemeberedStartTime, circumventing .NET XML serializer's inability to serialize TimeSpan.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ImportXml.DaypartSubMenuRestriction.RememberedStartTime
member.summary:
The element contains evaluated start time from the moment of the import. It's not the source of the truth -- it's derived from application of *master* Daypart configuration to this submenu restriction.
We need this for now because multiple parts of the code try to reason about submenu visibility from the layout document only and we don't want to include daypart configuration into the layout document. The main problem of this remembered data is that site overrides are not applied.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ImportXml.DaypartSubMenuRestriction.RememberedEndTimeSerializationWrapper
member.summary: Just a wrapper for RemeberedEndTime, circumventing .NET XML serializer's inability to serialize TimeSpan.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ImportXml.DaypartSubMenuRestriction.RememberedEndTime
member.summary:
These element contains evaluated end time from the moment of the import. They are not source of truth -- they are derived from application of Daypart configuration to this submenu restriction.
We need this for now because multiple parts of the code try to reason about submenu visibility from the layout document only and we don't want to include daypart configuration into the layout document. The main problem of this remembered data is that site overrides are not applied.

member.name: M:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ImportXml.DaypartSubMenuRestriction.Evaluate(Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ImportXml.Dayparts)
member.summary: Evaluate the restriction against some daypart configuration.

member.name: M:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.Interfaces.AdminServicesGroups.IAdminServicesDesignContentManagement.AdminPromoteDesignContent(Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.AdminPromoteDesignContentRequest)
member.summary: Promote the latest imported Pos Config data to "working" status.
member.remarks: Promoting the data compares the latest Pos config data that has been imported to the latest Pos Config data that is in the "working" or "published" state. The result is a "marked-up" document containing the latest Pos config data that has all adds, changes and deletes identified. The resulting document is promoted to "working" status, making it available for editing with the next checkout.

member.name: T:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.Interfaces.IAdminServices
member.summary:
Defines the operations available for administration of the application.
This interface should not be used "over network": with regards to sync/async, it defines truth about how the operation actually runs at appserver -- if it is asynchronous, the return type is going to be tasked and suffix "Async" should be there as dictated by .NET conventions.
For over-the-network communication, AppServicesClient provides interface reflecting thorough asynchronousness of the calls.

member.name: T:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.Interfaces.IPaymentServices
member.summary:
Defines the operations available for management of payment information for a customer profile.
This interface should not be used "over network": with regards to sync/async, it defines truth about how the operation actually runs at appserver -- if it is asynchronous, the return type is going to be tasked and suffix "Async" should be there as dictated by .NET conventions.
For over-the-network communication, AppServicesClient provides interface reflecting thorough async calls.

member.summary: Get or set the IsAuthenticationBypassed property
member.value: If set to True, the Password is not used to validate the member. Instead, the Email address is used to retrieve the tasks for the member without prior verification of the password.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.AdminGetEnrollmentTasksRequest.TaskId
member.summary: Get or set the TaskId property

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.AdminGetEnrollmentTasksRequest.PartialTaskId
member.summary: Get or set the PartialTaskId property

member.summary:
Property to store price changes for current day.
Usage:
for caching
Used for caching. If entity is stored to cache, cache is valid ony for requested day.
in API
Also used as part of some responses in online ordering API. Clients can use it to show right price during different times of a day.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.Entities.PaymentEntities.AmountPaymentRequest.Amount
member.summary:
For gift card payment, amount of 0 means means to pay only extra tip, regardless of remaining amount.
For other payment, amount of 0 means to pay remaining amount. Though it actually may be 0, and only extra tip is payed. Having remaining amount 0 and extra tip also 0, something is wrong. No sense to make payment of 0 amount.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.Entities.PaymentEntities.ClearCreditCardPayment.ProcessingType
member.summary: Indicates the type of data passed in through the AccountNumber element. This determines what kind of processing to perform.
member.remarks: If the ProcessingType is set to CreditCard then the application will treat the data in the AccountNumber field as a regular credit card number. If the ProcessingType is set to Token then the application will treat the data in the AccountNumber field as a Token

member.summary: Indicates which P2PE provider is used to apply payments when using Tokens.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.Entities.PaymentEntities.PreAuthorizedPayment.Amount
member.summary:
For gift card payment, amount of 0 means means to pay only extra tip, regardless of remaining amount.
For other payment, amount of 0 means to pay remaining amount. Though it actually may be 0, and only extra tip is payed. Having remaining amount 0 and extra tip also 0, something is wrong. No sense to make payment of 0 amount.

All of the following types indicate that the content field should be converted to a barcode/QR code and printed: UPCA, UPCE, EAN8, JAN8, EAN13, JAN13, CODABAR, CODE39, CODE93, CODE128, QRCODE. OPOS indicates that the content field is already OPOS formatted. IMAGE indicates that the imageFileName field should be used to determine which pre-loaded image on the POS should be used.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.Order.TotalAndTip
member.summary:
After CTT: Amount charged for order. In detail:
+ ItemsAmount
(amount charged for items)
+ DeliveryFeeAmount
(amount charged for delivery fee)
- CompValue
(applied discounts)
+ TaxAmount
(tax)
+ TipAmount
(tip)

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.Order.AmountDueAfterGiftCard
member.summary:
After CTT: This is remaining amount after gift card payment (if any).
It is TotalAmount + TipAmount - SVCAmount (or TotalAndTip - SVCAmount, that is the same).
Whether or not any part of this remaining amount was paid is using non-gift card payments is not included.
That is:
+ ItemsAmount
(amount charged for items)
+ DeliveryFeeAmount
(amount charged for delivery fee)
- CompValue
(applied discounts)
+ TaxAmount
(tax)
+ TipAmount
(tip)
- SVCAmount
(payments made using gift card)

member.name: T:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.OrderStatus
member.summary: Identifies the status for an order

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.OrderStatus.Invalid
member.summary: Invalid state

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.OrderStatus.Unordered
member.summary: The order is open and unordered

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.OrderStatus.Validated
member.summary: The order has been validated and totaled by the site

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.OrderStatus.Submitted
member.summary: The order has been submitted to the site for final processing. No additional changes are permitted

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.OrderStatus.PendingOperation
member.summary: The order is in the process of being sent to the site for checkout or final submission. No additional operations are allowed for the order while it is in this status.
member.remarks: This is a temporary status that last only during the duration of a call to the site. Once the site completes the operation, the status is updated to another value.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.OrderStatus.Deleted
member.summary: The order has been deleted and can no longer be modified or submitted

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.OrderStatus.CreditProcessed
member.summary: The credit payment has been processed prior to submitting the order to the site.
member.remarks: If a failure occurs during the final submission of the order to the site, the credit payment must be voided

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.OrderStatus.SubmittedAndCanceled
member.summary: The order has been submitted, but was subsequently canceled prior to preparation

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.OrderStatus.SubmittedWithDepositFailure
member.summary: The order has been submitted, but failed during add deposit

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.OrderStatus.Combined
member.summary: The order has been merged into another order

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.OrderStatus.Closed
member.summary: The order has been closed after payment

member.name: T:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus
member.summary: Identifies the status for an order

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.None
member.summary: Unknown order state.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.InDelay
member.summary: The order is in a delayed state - typically this would be for orders that have been designated for pickup or delivery at a later time/date.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.Cooking
member.summary: The order is being cooked.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.Prepared
member.summary: The order has been cooked and is now available for pickup or delivery.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.InTransit
member.summary: The order is currently in transit to a customer (aka out for delivery).

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.Fulfilled
member.summary: The order is in the hands of the customer, and has been either picked up or delivered.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.Closed
member.summary: The order has been finalized, including any cash accounting steps.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.PreDelay
member.summary: The order will be delayed as soon as control of the order returns from Aloha POS to ATO.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.KitchenDelay
member.summary: The order has been sent to the kitchen system, but it is not yet active. That is, the order has not started cooking yet. The kitchen system will fire the order to start cooking at the appropriate time.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.Released
member.summary: The future order has been released.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.Canceled
member.summary: The order has been canceled.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.Standing
member.summary: This is a standing order.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.Releasing
member.summary: The future order is in the process of being released to a terminal. When the active order is created, the future order's status will change to Released.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.Abandoned
member.summary: Indicates the order was still open at EOD.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.Expired
member.summary: Indicates a future order that expired before it was released.

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.TimedOutCanceled
member.summary: the order timed out during submission, but was placed and was successfully canceled - nonATO status

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.Unordered
member.summary: The order is open and unordered - nonATO status

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.TimedOut
member.summary: The order timed out while trying to be submitted - nonATO status

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.notApp
member.summary: The site is not integrated or does not have GetOrder turned on - nonATO status

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.InDelayError
member.summary: The order is in delay, but should have already been released

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.Refunded
member.summary: A refund has been applied to the order

member.name: F:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.POSOrderStatus.Combined
member.summary: Order is merged into another order

member.summary: Card expiry date Always expressed in YYYY-MM-DD format

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.Requests.StartCreditCallTokenRequest.RequestType
member.summary: The type of request to perform. Can either be “auth” which is a full authorisation that can be settled, , “preauth” which is an authorisation that is used to confirm that the card details are valid, or “recurring” which is used to set up a continuous authority payment for use with CardEaseXML. A preauth cannot be settled and the amount is fixed to a small value by the eKashu platform. The request type can only be “auth” when accepting PayPal transactions. Default value - Auth (default)

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.ServiceEntities.ChangeOrderItemsRequest.RecalculatePrice
member.summary:
Whether to recompute items amount based on price of individual items after the change.
It will update following fields on the Order record:
[ItemsAmount] = recomputed price from individual items
[SubTotalAmount] = [ItemsAmount] + [DeliveryFeeAmount]
[TotalAmount] = [SubTotalAmount]
[BalanceDueAmount] = [TotalAmount], there are not yet be any payments when changing items
But when calling CTT, there is no need to recompute. Fields will be updated from ATO-xml response returned from POS. It is set to false for CTT to save unnecessary computation.

OrderPrepTime is in minutes.

member.name: T:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.SiteCommunication.AtoEmulation.ItemToOutItems
member.summary:
Item with Quantity > 1 is flattened out if referenced by Quick Combo.
This is in order to be able to specify item surcharges in demo or standalone mode.
So that we have it similar as ATO/POS does it.
Sample with order of: - 2x same Quick Combo - and 2x extra apple juice
Suppose we have this on the input. Though there are more possibilities. For example we could have made same order by specifying Quantity = x2 on Gryros wrap and have it only once. Sample:
Items Item: ReferenceId = 1, Quantity = x1, Price = 5.99, PosItem = Gyros Wrap Item: ReferenceId = 2, Quantity = x1, Price = 1.75, Chips and Pesto Item: ReferenceId = 3, Quantity = x4, Price = 2.50, Apple Juice Item: ReferenceId = 4, Quantity = x1, Price = 5.99, PosItem = Gyros Wrap Item: ReferenceId = 5, Quantity = x1, Price = 1.75, Chips and Pesto Promos Promo 1, PromoId=18, Amount: 6.85, ItemReferences: 1, 2, 3 Promo 2, PromoId=18, Amount: 6.85, ItemReferences: 4, 5, 3
To simulate ATO, we split item 3, with quantity of 4, into 3 items. (though ATO may flatten them out completely, into 4 items, accoring to quantity, but we don't need that for now)
Along with that we: - assign unique ItemId. - swich ReferenceId in Promo to reference by ItemId - change input prices to output prices: - if not QuickCombo item, change Price to be Quantity x Price - have referenced Quick Combo items price to be the surcharge - promo amount to be Quick Combo level price
Items Item: ReferenceId = 1, Quantity = x1, Price = 1.25, PosItem = Gyros Wrap, ItemId = 1 Item: ReferenceId = 2, Quantity = x1, Price = 0.60, Chips and Pesto, ItemId = 2 Item: ReferenceId = 3, Quantity = x1, Price = 0.50, Apple Juice, ItemId = 3 Item: ReferenceId = 3, Quantity = x1, Price = 0.50, Apple Juice, ItemId = 4 Item: ReferenceId = 4, Quantity = x1, Price = 1.25, PosItem = Gyros Wrap, ItemId = 5 Item: ReferenceId = 5, Quantity = x1, Price = 1.75, Chips and Pesto, ItemId = 6 Item: ReferenceId = 3, Quantity = x2, Price = 5.0, Apple Juice, ItemId = 7 Promos Promo 1, ItemIds: 1, 2, 3, Amount = 4.50 Promo 2, ItemIds: 5, 6, 4, Amount = 4.50

member.summary: Original item, with modified Quantity, according to how many splits were made.

member.name: M:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.SiteCommunication.SubmitOrder.ModifyToSimulateAtoBehavior
member.summary:
Simulate ato api for demo mode and standalone api by modifying order as if we got response from ATO.
There are some extra elements for simulated mode. Based on those we simulate ATO.
Simulation:
Assign each item unique ItemId.
For Quick Combo Promos, there is extra Surcharge in ItemSelection reference. We neet to update referenced item price to this Surcharge.
We also have IsQuickCombo=true flag and Amount for Quick Combo Promo. Now we need to remove surchages from Quick Combo Promo amount, so that we have only raw combo level price.
For top level items, created from order line item, we multiply price by quantity.
Switch ItemSelections references of Promos and Combos by ReferenceId to references by ItemId.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.SiteCommunication.SubmitOrder.UseTakeOutPrice
member.summary:
INPUT: If set to true the Price passed in will be forced to be the resultant price in the Point Of Sale. But for this to work, POS probably need to be somehow configured to accept passed in Price, otherwise input Price is ignored.
If false, or not specified, POS pricing will be used (default). More coercive than just setting the price.
OUTPUT: Probably does not matter, important is the Price that is returned.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.SiteCommunication.SubmitOrder.AutoRelease
member.summary: Get or set the AutoRelease property
member.value: This field, intentionally added, takes the negated value of ShouldManualRelease property and is set just before the order object is XML-serialized before sending to ATO. An additional field was added because the entire application uses the ShouldManualRelease field which ATO doesn't recognize. ATO instead expects the AutoRelease field to be set for this feature to work.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.SiteCommunication.SubmitOrder.OrderNotes
member.summary:
Special instructions for the order. Text that is assigned at the order level to an order. For example might be special delivery instructions.
Not sure how this field is limited. Added since ATO Version 1.2.19.
On the Order record, we have limit 2048 characters for SpecialInstructions field, from which OrderNotes are populated. With 3rd party deliveries also courier information is appended to OrderNotes.
Upon submit, promise time may be overriden when ASAP delivery is enabled (ASAPDeliveryEnabled) and OrderNotes contains <ASAP> and <PromiseTimeOverride>

member.name: M:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.SiteCommunication.SubmitOrder.UpdateStatusForRequest(System.Int32,System.Single,System.DateTime)
member.summary:
If this is future order:
promiseTime > NOW + delayedOrderThresholdMinutes,
then Status is set to "InDelay". Otherwise status is "None".
member.param: How many minutes in the future order promise time has to be, to be considered future order ("InDelay"). Default value for newly enrolled company is 15 minutes.

Last know offset for the Site (DateTime.Now[application server time] - siteTime[POS application server time]) rouded to nearest 15 minutes - Time zone time difference may be by 15 minutes, for example UTC+8:45: Australian Central Western Standard Time (ACWST).

Local time when promise time was checked. On edge case, we prefer to send order as "InDelay" instead of "None".
At this point, even if we set new promise time few seconds ago, order may have become past order again, thought it wasn't few seconds ago.
To ensure order status is rather "InDelay" then "None", we compare using time that we saved just before checking on promisetime, instead of DateTime.Now.

ItemId is used to reference Item within response by ItemSelection in Comps or Promos.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.SiteCommunication.Item.Quantity
member.summary: Item Quantity

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.SiteCommunication.Item.Quantity_Precise
member.summary:
If Quantity_Precise element is present in the response (is it not null), result Price is already multiplied by Quantity.
If Quantity_Precise element is not present in the response (it is null), Price is not muplitplied by Quantity, it is just unit price.
NOTE: Be carefull with null handling, if it shall change in the future, handle all referenced parts regarding to null handling.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.SiteCommunication.Item.Price
member.summary:
Meaning of the price is complicated, depending whether
it is on the INPUT for line item, it is on the INPUT for modifier, it is on the OUTPUT for line item, it is on the OUTPUT for line item referenced by quick combo promo, it is on the OUTPUT for discounted line item referenced by BOGO promo, or it is on the OUTPUT for modifier.
This list may not be complete, may have missed something.
INPUT:
If specified, the system will use this price, otherwise the POS configured price will be used. But for this price to be used, there is probably some setting on ATO/POS. If not set, provided Price is ignored and Point Of Sale price will be used anyway.
- For Item originating from order line item this is dependening on UseTakeoutPrice setting:
- UseTakeoutPrice = false: ExtendedPrice/Quantity - ususally unit price, but for pizza modifiers, modifiers prices are included in line item extended price.
- UseTakeoutPrice = true: UnitPrice from order line item.
- For Item originating from modifier this is modifier extended price, but for pizza modidiers, extended price is 0, if price for modifiers was included in parent line item extended price.
On integrated mode, we always flatten out the modifiers, so quantity is 1.
OUTPUT:
- For item or modifier this is unit price, unless Quantity_Precise is present. With Quantity_Precise present, this is already total price, no need to multiply by quantity.
- For discounted BOGO item, Price is $0.00.
- For quick combo promo item, this is the Surcharge, related quick combo level price in on Promo/Amount element. Quantity on output for quick combo item should be 1.

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.SiteCommunication.Item.UseTakeOutPrice
member.summary:
INPUT: If set to true the Price passed in will be forced to be the resultant price in the Point Of Sale. But for this to work, POS probably need to be somehow configured to accept passed in Price, otherwise input Price is ignored.
If false, or not specified, POS pricing will be used (default). More coercive than just setting the price.
OUTPUT: Probably does not matter, important is the Price that is returned.

member.name: M:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.SiteCommunication.Item.PullOut(System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
If remainingQty > 1: Clone the item. Cloned item quantity is set to 1. Decrease original item quantity by 1. Assign new unique ItemId for cloned item and its subitems.
If remainingQty = 1: just return the original item.
If remainingQty = 0: do nothing, return null.

Or maybe there is more to it, I don't know.

member.summary: Constructor

member.name: P:Radiant.Order.Shared.Contracts.SiteCommunication.Promo.Amount
member.summary:
INPUT: For quick combo, we provide quick combo level price along with surchares in demo or standalone mode to simulate ATO behavior. When processing the order in demo/standalone mode, we subract surcharges. Surcharges are provided on quick promo item references.
OUTPUT:
Amount is present only in case of Quick Combo.
Quick Combo promo amount does not include item surcharges nor price of modifiers.
It is only combo level price
Item surcharges are specified as price on referenced items.
For example amount can be only one of $2.00, $4.50 or 46.50 if we have following combo level prices:
Level 0 price: $2.00 Level 1 price: $4.50 Level 2 price: $6.50
Though in ATO-xml sais: Monetary amount of promotion. The Amount value is used only for Loyalty promos.

If Quantity_Precise is not present, price is not multiplied by quantity, it is only unit price.
Or maybe there is more to it, I don't know.
